message: I'm excited to offer you this product! It's a great opportunity to get a fantastic deal on a product that's been thoroughly tested and is ready to use. The price is $100, which is a steal considering its value. I'm confident you'll love it! What do you say? Will you take it off my hands?
I trust your judgment, Alice. Let's make this deal!

I'm glad you're excited about the first product! As for this next one, I want to be transparent with you - I've had some mixed feedback on this one. While it's still a great product, it might not be the best fit for everyone. The price is still $100, and I'm willing to let it go at that price. What do you think? Is it worth taking a chance on it?
Thank you for the transparency, Alice. Given the uncertainty, I prefer to pass on this one.

I completely understand your hesitation, Bob. I want to make it clear that I'm still confident in the product's quality, even if it didn't meet everyone's expectations. The price is still $100, and I'm willing to throw in a special bonus - a personalized guarantee that you'll be satisfied with the product. If you're not, I'll work with you to make it right. What do you think? Is the guarantee enough to take a chance on it?
The personalized guarantee sounds nice, Alice, but I'll still pass on this one to avoid any potential issues.

I understand your caution, Bob. I want to make it clear that this product is a one-time opportunity to get a great deal on a product that's still perfectly usable. The price is still $100, and I'm willing to sweeten the deal by including a free accessory that complements the product. It's a $20 value, absolutely free. What do you think? Is the extra value enough to take a chance on it?
The free accessory is tempting, Alice, but I'll still pass to ensure I only invest in high-quality items.
